item.title: Research
item.description: Research Interests My main research interests are in real-time systems and autonomous systems, including: Real-time scheduling and allocation on single- and multi-cores; Flexible and feedback-based methods for task/network scheduling; Control-scheduling co-design and design automation of CPS; Real-time I/O and high predictability computing architecture; Assuring timing and safety of robotic and autonomous systems. Research Projects ➤ MOCHA: Modelling and Optimising Complex Heterogenous Architectures (2019 - 2022) PostDoc, funded by Huawei Technologies Co.

Jing Hu Lecturer College of Geological Engineering and Geomatics Chang’an University Xi’an, China Address: Room 814, Earth Science Building Department of Geological Engineering and Geomatics Chang’an Unversity Xi’an, China Email: jhsa920@163.com Introduction I am a research associate in the Real-Time Systems Research Group (RTSRG) at the University of York, UK. I am currently working on the MOCHA research project with Dr. Iain Bate. The MOCHA project focuses on modelling and scheduling of complex architectures with high performance and stringent timing requirements for next-generation communication stations.

Ongoing papers Hu, J., Guo H., Zhang H., Seismic attenuation tomography of the Gofar Transform Fault, East Pacific Rise Using OBS observations (in preparation) Hu, J., Qiu H., Share P., Qian J., Zhang H., Ben-Zion Y., (2019) Time-dependent earthquake tomography in Southern California (in preparation) Papers Yang, S., Hu, J., Zhang, H., & Liu, G. (2020). Simultaneous earthquake detection on multiple stations via convolutional neural network. Seism.
